job_title: Pharmacy Technician in Staten Island, NY
pros: Providing the best patient care
cons: Miserable toxic co workers. Hospital culture is severely toxic, work environment and culture both creating staff tensions. Also major impact with union people vs “non union” management. The pharmacy management in particular use bullying and intimidation tactics to get their way on a daily basis. It’s common for “backstabbing” co workers (in disguise) to sabotage one another (of any rank by the way so watch your back carefully!)

job_title: Registered Nurse in Staten Island, NY
pros: I’ve met some great people, have grown a lot since the start of my career, tuition reimbursement, salary and benefits are comparable to other large organizations.
cons: Aside from having extremely unsafe staffing pre-pandemic and to date-Northwell at SIUH North is an emotionally and physically exhausting workplace. Favoritism within management who tend to gossip. Morale is low amongst staff in all departments. People are overworked, undervalued, underpaid and exhausted. Your best never feels like it is enough.

review_title: Above and beyond with safety, quality and patient experience

review_title: Not a nice place to work!
job_title: Clerical in Staten Island, NY
pros: Make lasting relationships with co-workers.
cons: Management does not know how to speak nor treat their employees. Good employees are not valued or recognized. Not all employees are treated equal. There is a lot of favoritism by Management shown to certain employees and not to others. Any complaints regarding Management seem to go no where and employees work out of fear not respect for their Manager's/Supervisor's. Salary increases are very low and are not merit based so there is no incentive to do your best.

review_title: Just keeping it real. Hopefully this will be a better place to work in the near future.
job_title: Clerical in Staten Island, NY
pros: Most Co-workers are team players. Build strong lasting relationships with employees you work with.
cons: Managerial staff does not how to treat or speak to employees and complaints do not seem to be taken seriously. Salary could be better and yearly raise increases are very low. The favoritism that manager's show to certain employees and not to others runs rampant at SIUH. Changes need to be made in a big way.

job_title: Executive Secretary in Staten Island, NY
pros: Great people to work with. Great vision for their company. Great for someone who is interested the medical field and who wants to expand their career in that field.
cons: You have to fight in the beginning for them to offer more money. My original offer was $50k then they said we can’t go that high we will do $45k. I needed to really negotiate to get the salary I wanted.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Staten Island, NY
pros: great place to work, friendly staff, good hours, normal case load.  Easy commute and parking.  Young staff that plans fun social events

review_title: A good place to start out, as there are many learning opportunities available.

review_title: It's the only game in town.

review_title: Good Opportunities, Fair Pay but Many Rules and Regulations
job_title: Patient Transporter in New York, NY

-Competitive salary and good benefits
- Various work tasks to keep you engaged and interested
- Make a difference in a community that needs care.
cons:
Lots of micromanagement, many rules and regulations

job_title: Registered Nurse in New York, NY

job_title: Registrar in Staten Island, NY

cons: A lot of reorganizing. Recent layoffs and senior buyouts. There are positions that are covered by unions which may not always benefit the hard workers. Slackers don't have to worry about being let go because they are protected by union.
